trial_identification.studytitle: A Study for Patients With Non-Hodgkin's Lymphomas
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Multicenter, Open-label, Noncomparative Study of Enzastaurin in Patients With Non-Hodgkin's Lymphomas

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Lymphoma (non Hodgkin's lymphoma) - High grade lymphoma
Lymphoma (non Hodgkin's lymphoma) - Low grade lymphoma

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - enzastaurin
Experimental: 1 - Indolent B-Cell
Experimental: 2 - Aggressive B-Cell
Experimental: 3 - T-Cell
Treatment: drugs: enzastaurin 1125 mg loading dose then 500 mg, oral, daily until progressive disease

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: time of response to progressive disease

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Have measurable lesions
- Have recovered from prior chemotherapies
- Have an estimated life expectancy of at least 12 weeks
- Hepatic: total bilirubin less than or equal to 1.5 XULN; ATL/AST less than or equal to 2.0 x ULN (less than 5x if liver metastases are present)
- Renal: serum creatinine less than or equal to 1.5XULN
- Adequate bone marrow reserve: platelets greater than or equal to 75 x 109 /L, absolute neutrophil count (ANC) greater than or equal to 1.0 x 09 /L
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Have a second primary malignancy (except adequately treated nonmelanomatous skin cancer, or other cancer that is considered cured by surgical resection or radiation).
- Anti-lymphoma therapy within the past 3 weeks
- Unable to swallow tablets
- Unable to discontinue use of carbamazepine, phenobarbital and phenytoin at least 14 days prior to study enrollment

recruitment.hospital: For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician. - Garran

For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician. - Gosford

For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician. - Auchenflower

For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician. - Prahran

ethicsAndSummary.summary:
In this study, all patients will get investigational drug. There will be no comparator drug. This study will evaluate three tumor types: T-cell lymphoma, Indolent B-cell lymphoma, and Aggressive B-cell lymphoma. Each tumor type will include several tumor subtypes:
- T-cell lymphoma: Peripheral and Cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (PTCL, CTCL)
- Indolent B-cell lymphoma: Small lymphocytic lymphoma, follicular lymphoma (Gr 1 or 2) and marginal zone lymphoma
- Aggressive B-cell lymphoma: Primary CNS lymphoma, follicular lymphoma (Gr 3a and 3b) and aggressive lymphoma with prior clinical history of indolent lymphoma.

contact.name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon - Fri 9 AM - 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST)
